hello I am neerja a technical account
manager here at the AWS office in Dallas
today I am going to show you how to
troubleshoot your server when it cannot
receive email after you created an MX
record in Amazon now53 let's get started
after logging into the AWS Management
console navigate to the Route 53 console
create the appropriate resource record
sets for your SMTP server these record
names and values are provided by your
mail server provider
if you are using Route 53 for DNS
service and another domain name
registrar for domain registration verify
that your domain name registrar
references the name servers in your
Route 53 public hosted source to do this
query an internet based who is utility
in a command line session and type
following command substituting your
domain name for domain.com
the query results include the domain
name registrar and the authoritative
name servers for the domain name
if the query results return a list of
name servers other than the name servers
that are associated with your Route 53
public hosted Zone then the DNS query
for your SMTP server won't be sent to
the route 53. update the name servers in
your domain registrar's console and use
Route 53 public hosted zones name server
for your domain now verify for DNS MX
record resolution type following command
in the command line for Linux or Mac OS
use
for Windows use
then use the following command to
confirm that you can resolve MX record
host name for Linux or Mac OS use
for Windows use
please note some DNS providers require
that you prepared an at symbol to an MX
record set name or providers might
require you to create an MX record set
with the name at the rate when creating
an MX record set for a root domain
however don't repent row 53 MX records
set names with the at the rate or any
other symbol to create an MX record set
for a root domain in Route 53 leave the
record set name blank then provide the
appropriate values for the remaining
fields of the Route 53 MX record set
connect to the mail server and test your
ability to send and receive email using
SMTP commands if you make a
typographical error while entering this
command be sure to press enter pressing
backspace or delete doesn't work in this
case after pressing enter retry the
command in some cases it might be
necessary to close the telnet session
and recollect
then enter the following command and
press enter
the following command and then press
enter
enter the following command and then
press enter please note the sender and
recipient can have the same email
address
the server responds with 250 accepted
if the server can verify information
such as the sender and recipient then
the message is confirmed as accepted
enter the following command and then
press enter
the following command and then press
enter
enter the following command and then
press enter
the following command and then press
enter
the message is accepted for delivery the
server responds with 250 OK which
indicates that the email was sent if you
confirm that the MX record is configured
correctly but your SMTP server is still
unable to receive email contact your
email service provider for more help and
now you know how to troubleshoot your
server when it cannot receive email
after you created an MX record in rav53
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
